00081 typedef enum TEXTDISPLAY_UpdateMode_t
00082 {
00083   TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL,
00084   TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_LINE,
00085   TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_CHAR,
00086   TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE

00090 typedef struct TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t
00091 {
00092   int               displayDeviceNo;    /* Display device number to initialize
00093                                            test display on. */
00094   DISPLAY_Device_t  displayDevice;      /* Display properties. */
00095   
00096   unsigned int      columns;            /* Number of columns to use. */
00097   unsigned int      lines;              /* Number of lines to use. */
00098   
00099   bool              scrollEnable;       /* Enable/disable scrolling mode on the
00100                                            text display. Scrolling mode will
00101                                            consume more memory because the lines
00102                                            lines will have to be stored in
00103                                            memory. */
00104   
00105   bool                     lfToCrLf;    
00108   DISPLAY_PixelMatrix_t    lineBuffer;  
00111   char*                    charBuffer;  
00112   char**                   charArray;   
00114   uint8_t                  rgbColor[3]; 
00116   unsigned int             xpos;        
00117   unsigned int             ypos;        
00119   TEXTDISPLAY_UpdateMode_t updateMode;  
00121   bool                     initialized; 
00123 } TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t;

00219 /**************************************************************************/
00229 EMSTATUS TEXTDISPLAY_New(TEXTDISPLAY_Config_t  *config,
00230                          TEXTDISPLAY_Handle_t  *handle)
00231 {
00232   TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*    textdisplay;
00233   int                      deviceNo;
00234   unsigned int             i;
00235   EMSTATUS                 status;
00236 
00237   /* Find unused text display device structure. */
00238   for (textdisplay=NULL,
00239          deviceNo=0; deviceNo<TEXTDISPLAY_DEVICES_MAX; deviceNo++)
00240   {
00241     if (false == textdisplayTbl[deviceNo].initialized)
00242     {
00243       textdisplay = &textdisplayTbl[deviceNo];
00244       break;
00245     }
00246   }
00247   if (NULL == textdisplay)
00248   {
00249     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY;
00250   }
00251 
00252   /* Retrieve the properties of the DISPLAY. */
00253   status =
00254     DISPLAY_DeviceGet(config->displayDeviceNo, &textdisplay->displayDevice);
00255   if (DISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK != status)
00256     return status;
00257 
00258   /* If the display address mode is DISPLAY_ADDRESSING_BY_ROWS_ONLY we need
00259      a buffer to draw the current line with new characters as they arrive. */
00260   if (DISPLAY_ADDRESSING_BY_ROWS_ONLY == textdisplay->displayDevice.addressMode)
00261   {
00262     status =
00263       textdisplay->displayDevice.
00264       pPixelMatrixAllocate (&textdisplay->displayDevice,
00265                             textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width,
00266 #ifdef EMWIN_WORKAROUND
00267                             textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width,
00268 #endif
00269                             FONT_HEIGHT,
00270                             &textdisplay->lineBuffer);
00271     if (DISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK != status)
00272       return status;
00273 
00274     status =
00275       textdisplay->displayDevice.
00276       pPixelMatrixClear (&textdisplay->displayDevice,
00277                          textdisplay->lineBuffer,
00278                          textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width,
00279                          FONT_HEIGHT);
00280                                                       
00281     if (DISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK != status)
00282       return status;
00283   }
00284   else
00285   {
00286     textdisplay->lineBuffer = NULL;
00287   }
00288 
00289   /* Check that the requested number of text rows and columns fits inside the
00290      geometry of the display device. */
00291   if (charBufferTbl[deviceNo].lines >
00292       textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.height / FONT_HEIGHT)
00293     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OUT_OF_RANGE;
00294   if (charBufferTbl[deviceNo].columns >
00295       textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width / FONT_WIDTH)
00296     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OUT_OF_RANGE;
00297 
00298   /* Remember the character buffer parameters. */
00299   textdisplay->lines      = charBufferTbl[deviceNo].lines;
00300   textdisplay->columns    = charBufferTbl[deviceNo].columns;
00301   textdisplay->charBuffer = charBufferTbl[deviceNo].charBuffer;
00302   textdisplay->charArray  = charBufferTbl[deviceNo].charArray;
00303 
00304   /* Store user configuration options */
00305   textdisplay->displayDeviceNo   = config->displayDeviceNo;
00306   textdisplay->scrollEnable      = config->scrollEnable;
00307   textdisplay->lfToCrLf          = config->lfToCrLf;
00308 
00309   /* Setup char pointer array */
00310   for (i=0; i<textdisplay->lines; i++)
00311     textdisplay->charArray[i] =
00312       textdisplay->charBuffer + textdisplay->columns * i;
00313   
00314   /* Initialize color for text */
00315   /* Use \b for red text (bell/warning) */
00316   textdisplay->rgbColor[0]       = 0xff;
00317   textdisplay->rgbColor[1]       = 0xff;
00318   textdisplay->rgbColor[2]       = 0xff;
00319   
00320   /* Clear character buffer */
00321   TextdisplayClear(textdisplay);
00322 
00323   textdisplay->initialized      = true;
00324 
00325   *handle = (TEXTDISPLAY_Handle_t*) textdisplay;
00326 
00327   return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK;
00328 }
00329

00331 /**************************************************************************/
00341 EMSTATUS TEXTDISPLAY_Delete(TEXTDISPLAY_Handle_t  handle)
00342 {
00343   TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*  textdisplay = (TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*) handle;
00344 
00345   if (textdisplay->initialized)
00346   {
00347     textdisplay->charBuffer = NULL;
00348     textdisplay->charArray = NULL;
00349 
00350     if (textdisplay->lineBuffer)
00351     {
00352       textdisplay->displayDevice.pPixelMatrixFree (&textdisplay->displayDevice,
00353                                                    textdisplay->lineBuffer);
00354       textdisplay->lineBuffer = NULL;
00355     }
00356 
00357     /* Clear display device number to allow reinitialization of this display.*/
00358     textdisplay->displayDeviceNo = -1;
00359 
00360     textdisplay->initialized = false;
00361    
00362     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK;
00363   }
00364 
00365   return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_INVALID_PARAM;
00366 }

00391 /**************************************************************************/
00400 EMSTATUS TEXTDISPLAY_WriteChar(TEXTDISPLAY_Handle_t  handle,
00401                                char                  c)
00402 {
00403   TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*  textdisplay = (TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*) handle;
00404 
00405   /* Check that we are initialized. */
00406   if (false == textdisplay->initialized)
00407   {
00408     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED;
00409   }
00410 
00411   /* Determine initial display update mode. */
00412   if (DISPLAY_ADDRESSING_BY_ROWS_ONLY == textdisplay->displayDevice.addressMode)
00413   {
00414     textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_LINE;
00415   }
00416   else
00417   {      
00418     textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_CHAR;
00419   }
00420 
00421   if (textdisplay->scrollEnable)
00422   {
00423     /* Update the full screen (which has been scrolled up) if we start at the
00424        bottom left position and scroll is enabled. */
00425     if ((0==textdisplay->xpos) && (textdisplay->ypos == textdisplay->lines-1))
00426     {
00427       textdisplay->updateMode  = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00428     }
00429   }
00430   else
00431   {
00432     /* Update the full screen (which is cleared) if we start at top left
00433        position and scroll is not enabled. */
00434     if ((0==textdisplay->xpos) && (0==textdisplay->ypos))
00435     {
00436       textdisplay->updateMode  = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00437     }
00438   }
00439 
00440   /* Check for form feed - clear screen */
00441   if (c == '\f')
00442   {
00443     TextdisplayClear(textdisplay);
00444     /* Update the whole display and return. */
00445     textdisplay->updateMode  = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00446     return TextdisplayUpdate(textdisplay);
00447   }
00448 
00449   /* Add CR or LF to CRLF if enabled */
00450   if (textdisplay->lfToCrLf && (c == '\n'))
00451   {
00452     TextdisplayCharAdd(textdisplay, '\r');
00453   }
00454   TextdisplayCharAdd(textdisplay, c);
00455 
00456   if (TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE != textdisplay->updateMode)
00457     /* Update display and return. */
00458     return TextdisplayUpdate(textdisplay);
00459   else
00460     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK;
00461 }
00462 
00463 
00464 /**************************************************************************/
00473 EMSTATUS TEXTDISPLAY_WriteString(TEXTDISPLAY_Handle_t  handle,
00474                                  char*                 str)
00475 {
00476   TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*  textdisplay = (TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*) handle;
00477   EMSTATUS               status;
00478   char                   c;
00479   bool                   displayUpdated=false;
00480 
00481   /* Check that we are initialized. */
00482   if (false == textdisplay->initialized)
00483   {
00484     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED;
00485   }
00486 
00487   /* Determine initial display update mode. */
00488   if (DISPLAY_ADDRESSING_BY_ROWS_ONLY == textdisplay->displayDevice.addressMode)
00489   {
00490     textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_LINE;
00491   }
00492   else
00493   {      
00494     textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_CHAR;
00495   }
00496 
00497   while (*str)
00498   {
00499     /* Mark display as NOT updated. */
00500     displayUpdated = false;
00501 
00502     /* Clear screen if we start at top left position and scroll is not
00503        enabled. */
00504     if ((0==textdisplay->xpos) && (0==textdisplay->ypos) &&
00505         (false == textdisplay->scrollEnable))
00506     {
00507       TextdisplayClear(textdisplay);
00508       textdisplay->updateMode  = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00509     }
00510 
00511     c = *str;
00512 
00513     switch (c)
00514     {
00515     case '\f':
00516       /* Form feed - clear screen */
00517       TextdisplayClear(textdisplay);
00518       textdisplay->updateMode  = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00519       break;
00520 
00521     case '\n':
00522       /* Update display before proceeding to the next line. */
00523       status = TextdisplayUpdate(textdisplay);
00524       if (status != TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK)
00525         return status;
00526 
00527       displayUpdated = true;
00528 
00529       /* Add CR or LF to CRLF if enabled */
00530       if (textdisplay->lfToCrLf)
00531       {
00532         TextdisplayCharAdd(textdisplay, '\r');
00533       }
00534 
00535       TextdisplayCharAdd(textdisplay, c);
00536       break;
00537 
00538     default:
00539       TextdisplayCharAdd(textdisplay, c);
00540       break;
00541     }
00542 
00543     /* Update display if we reach the end of the line or a full display update
00544        is required. */
00545     if ((textdisplay->xpos >= textdisplay->columns) ||
00546         (textdisplay->updateMode == TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL))
00547     {
00548       status = TextdisplayUpdate(textdisplay);
00549       if (status != TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK)
00550         return status;
00551       displayUpdated = true;
00552     }
00553 
00554     str++;
00555   }
00556 
00557   /* Update display if not updated. */
00558   if (!displayUpdated)
00559     return TextdisplayUpdate(textdisplay);
00560   else
00561     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK;
00562 }
00563

00567 /*******************************************************************************
00568  ****************************   STATIC FUNCTIONS   *****************************
00569  ******************************************************************************/

00571 /**************************************************************************/
00576 static void TextdisplayClear(TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t* textdisplay)
00577 {
00578   if (textdisplay->charArray)
00579   {
00580 
00581 #if (FONT_ASCII_START>' ') || (FONT_ASCII_START+FONT_CHARACTERS<' ')
00582     /* The font does not include the space character at the standard position
00583        according to the ascii table. Then the pace should be placed at the
00584        "end" of the font table. */
00585     memset(textdisplay->charBuffer, FONT_CHARACTERS - 1,
00586            textdisplay->lines * textdisplay->columns);
00587 #else
00588     memset(textdisplay->charBuffer, 0,
00589            textdisplay->lines * textdisplay->columns);
00590 #endif
00591 
00592     /* Set cursor position to upper left */
00593     textdisplay->xpos = 0;
00594     textdisplay->ypos = 0;
00595 
00596     textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00597   }
00598 }
00599 
00600 
00601 /**************************************************************************/
00606 static void TextdisplayScrollUp(TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*  textdisplay)
00607 {
00608   unsigned int y;
00609 
00610   /* copy all lines one line up */
00611   for (y = 0; y < (textdisplay->lines - 1); y++)
00612   {
00613     memcpy(textdisplay->charArray[y],
00614            textdisplay->charArray[y + 1],
00615            textdisplay->columns);
00616   }
00617 
00618   /* clear last line */
00619   memset(&textdisplay->charArray[textdisplay->lines - 1][0],
00620          0,
00621          textdisplay->columns);
00622 
00623   textdisplay->xpos       = 0;
00624   textdisplay->ypos       = textdisplay->lines - 1;
00625   textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL;
00626 }

00628 
00629 #ifdef INCLUDE_VIDEO_TERMINAL_ESCAPE_SEQUENCE_SUPPORT
00630 /**************************************************************************/
00641 static bool TextdisplayEscapeSequence(TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t* textdisplay,
00642                                       int                   c)
00643 {
00644 #define ASCII_ESC                           (27)
00645 #define ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX                     (4)
00646 #define ESC_SEQ_MAX                          (6)
00647   static char escapeSequence[ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX]= {0,0,0,0};
00648   static const char escapeSequences[ESC_SEQ_MAX][ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX] =
00649   {
00650     /* Do not change the order of the escape sequences in the table below,
00651      and make sure they correspond to the TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_XXX contants
00652      below. */
00653     TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQ_CURSOR_HOME_VT100,
00654     TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQ_CURSOR_HOME_VT52,
00655     TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQ_CURSOR_UP_ONE_LINE,
00656     TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQ_CURSOR_DOWN_ONE_LINE,
00657     TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQ_CURSOR_RIGHT_ONE_CHAR,
00658     TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQ_CURSOR_LEFT_ONE_CHAR
00659   };
00660 #define TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_HOME_VT100        (0)
00661 #define TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_HOME_VT52         (1)
00662 #define TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_UP_ONE_LINE       (2)
00663 #define TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_DOWN_ONE_LINE     (3)
00664 #define TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_RIGHT_ONE_CHAR    (4)
00665 #define TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_LEFT_ONE_CHAR     (5)
00666 
00667   char*       pChar;
00668   int         seqNo;
00669   bool        anyMatch = false;
00670 
00671   /* Handle escape sequence */
00672   if (ASCII_ESC == c)
00673   {
00674     /* Clear escape sequence, store the ESC character, update mode none and
00675        return true. */
00676     memset(escapeSequence, 0, ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX);
00677     escapeSequence[0]=c;
00678     textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE;
00679     return true;
00680   }
00681 
00682   if (ASCII_ESC != escapeSequence[0])
00683   {
00684     /* We are not currently receiving an escape sequence. Just return false. */
00685     return false;
00686   }
00687   else
00688   {
00689     unsigned int len;
00690 
00691     /* We are currently receiving an escape sequence. Append the character to
00692        the end of the current escape sequence buffer and check if the sequence
00693        matches any of the supported sequences. */
00694 
00695     pChar = escapeSequence;
00696     while (*(++pChar));
00697     *pChar = c;
00698 
00699     len = strlen(escapeSequence);
00700 
00701     for (seqNo=0; seqNo<ESC_SEQ_MAX; seqNo++)
00702     {
00703       /* Check for supported escape sequences.*/
00704       if (0 == strncmp(escapeSequence, escapeSequences[seqNo], len))
00705       {
00706         /* We match part of the cursor home sequence. Set anyMatch and update
00707            mode to none. */
00708         anyMatch = true;
00709         textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE;
00710       
00711         /* Full match? */
00712         if (len == strlen(escapeSequences[seqNo]))
00713         {
00714           switch (seqNo)
00715           {
00716           case TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_HOME_VT100:
00717           case TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_HOME_VT52:
00718             /* Move cursor to upper left corner, and set update mode to none. */
00719             textdisplay->ypos = 0;
00720             textdisplay->xpos = 0;
00721             break;
00722           case TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_UP_ONE_LINE:
00723             /* Move cursor up one line. */
00724             if (textdisplay->ypos)
00725               textdisplay->ypos--;
00726             break;
00727           case TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_DOWN_ONE_LINE:
00728             /* Move cursor down one line. */
00729             if (textdisplay->ypos < textdisplay->lines-1)
00730               textdisplay->ypos++;
00731             break;
00732           case TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_RIGHT_ONE_CHAR:
00733             /* Move cursor right one column. */
00734             if (textdisplay->xpos < textdisplay->columns-1)
00735               textdisplay->xpos++;
00736             break;
00737           case TEXTDISPLAY_ESC_SEQNO_CURSOR_LEFT_ONE_CHAR:
00738             /* Move cursor left one column. */
00739             if (textdisplay->xpos)
00740               textdisplay->xpos--;
00741             break;
00742           }
00743 
00744           /* Clear escape sequence, set no display update and return true. */
00745           memset(escapeSequence, 0, ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX);
00746           textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE;
00747           return true;
00748         }
00749 
00750         /* We found a partial match. Break out of the loop and return in order
00751            to await the next character. */
00752         break;
00753       }
00754     }
00755     
00756     if (false == anyMatch)
00757     {
00758       /* No match found. Clear escape sequence and return false. */
00759       memset(escapeSequence, 0, ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX);
00760       return false;
00761     }
00762 
00763     if (ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX-1 == len)
00764     {
00765       /* The next character will overflow the escape sequence buffer.
00766          Clear the escape sequence buffer and return true. */
00767       memset(escapeSequence, 0, ESC_SEQ_SIZE_MAX);
00768       textdisplay->updateMode = TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE;
00769       return true;
00770     }
00771     
00772     return anyMatch;
00773   }
00774 }
00775 
00776 #endif /* INCLUDE_VIDEO_TERMINAL_ESCAPE_SEQUENCE_SUPPORT */
00777 
00778 
00779 /**************************************************************************/
00792 static void TextdisplayCharAdd(TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t* textdisplay,
00793                                int                   c)
00794 {
00795   switch (c)
00796   {
00797   case '\r':  /* check for CR */
00798     textdisplay->xpos = 0;
00799     return;
00800     
00801   case '\n':  /* check for LF */
00802     textdisplay->ypos = textdisplay->ypos + 1;
00803     textdisplay->xpos = 0;
00804     if (textdisplay->ypos >= textdisplay->lines)
00805     {
00806       if (textdisplay->scrollEnable)
00807       {
00808         /* Scroll characters one line up */
00809         TextdisplayScrollUp(textdisplay);
00810         textdisplay->ypos = (textdisplay->lines - 1);
00811       }
00812       else
00813       {
00814         TextdisplayClear(textdisplay);
00815       }
00816     }
00817     return;
00818 
00819   case '\b':  /* check for bell character, changes color to red */
00820     if ( (DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME !=
00821           textdisplay->displayDevice.colourMode) &&
00822          (DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME_INVERSE !=
00823           textdisplay->displayDevice.colourMode) )
00824     {
00825       if (textdisplay->rgbColor[1] == 0xff)
00826       {
00827         textdisplay->rgbColor[1] = 0x00;
00828         textdisplay->rgbColor[2] = 0x00;
00829       }
00830       else
00831       {
00832         textdisplay->rgbColor[1] = 0xff;
00833         textdisplay->rgbColor[2] = 0xff;
00834       }
00835       return;
00836     }
00837 
00838   }
00839 
00840 #ifdef INCLUDE_VIDEO_TERMINAL_ESCAPE_SEQUENCE_SUPPORT
00841   if (TextdisplayEscapeSequence(textdisplay, c))
00842   {
00843     /* We have detected an escape sequence. Return now. */
00844     return;
00845   }
00846 #endif
00847 
00848   /* Check for non-printable characters, and, if so, replace with space. */
00849   if (!isprint(c))
00850   {
00851     c = ' ';
00852   }
00853 
00854 #if 100 > FONT_CHARACTERS
00855   /* The font does not have all printable characters in the ASCII table.
00856      Check if character is supported. */
00857   if ( (FONT_ASCII_START>c) || (FONT_ASCII_START+FONT_CHARACTERS<=c) )
00858   {
00859 #if (FONT_ASCII_START>' ') || (FONT_ASCII_START+FONT_CHARACTERS<' ')
00860     /* Replace with an empty character (space) which should be placed at the
00861        "end" of the font table. */
00862     c = FONT_ASCII_START + FONT_CHARACTERS - 1;
00863 #else
00864     c = ' ';
00865 #endif
00866   }
00867 #endif
00868 
00869   if (textdisplay->xpos >= textdisplay->columns)
00870   {
00871     textdisplay->xpos = 0;
00872     textdisplay->ypos = textdisplay->ypos + 1;
00873   }
00874   if (textdisplay->ypos >= textdisplay->lines)
00875   {
00876     if (textdisplay->scrollEnable)
00877     {
00878       TextdisplayScrollUp(textdisplay);
00879       textdisplay->ypos = textdisplay->lines - 1;
00880     }
00881     else
00882     {
00883       TextdisplayClear(textdisplay);
00884     }
00885   }
00886   textdisplay->charArray[textdisplay->ypos][textdisplay->xpos] = 
00887     c - FONT_ASCII_START;
00888 
00889   textdisplay->xpos = textdisplay->xpos + 1;
00890 
00891   return;
00892 }
00893 
00894 
00895 /**************************************************************************/
00903 static EMSTATUS TextdisplayLineDraw(TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*  textdisplay,
00904                                     unsigned int           y)
00905 {
00906   unsigned int x, i;
00907   uint8_t      c;
00908   FontBits_t*  rowPtr = (FontBits_t*) textdisplay->lineBuffer;
00909   FontBits_t   pixelBits;
00910 
00911   for (i = 0; i < FONT_HEIGHT; i++)
00912   {
00913     for (x = 0; x < textdisplay->columns; x++)
00914     {
00915       c = textdisplay->charArray[y][x];
00916 
00917       pixelBits = fontBits[c + FONT_CHARACTERS * i];
00918 
00919       switch (textdisplay->displayDevice.colourMode)
00920       {
00921 #if (8 == FONT_WIDTH) || (16 == FONT_WIDTH)
00922       case DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME:
00923         rowPtr[x] = pixelBits;
00924         break;
00925     
00926       case DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME_INVERSE:
00927         rowPtr[x] = ~pixelBits;
00928         break;
00929 #elif (8 > FONT_WIDTH) || (16 > FONT_WIDTH)
00930       case DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME_INVERSE:
00931         pixelBits = ~pixelBits;
00932       case DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME:
00933       {
00934         int startPixel = x * FONT_WIDTH;
00935         int pixelNo = startPixel;
00936         for (; pixelNo<startPixel+FONT_WIDTH; pixelBits>>=1, pixelNo++)
00937         {
00938           if (pixelBits & 0x1)
00939           {
00940             rowPtr[pixelNo>>FONT_BITS_LOG2] |= 1 << (pixelNo&FONT_BITS_MASK);
00941           }
00942           else
00943           {
00944             rowPtr[pixelNo>>FONT_BITS_LOG2] &= ~(1 << (pixelNo&FONT_BITS_MASK));
00945           }
00946         }
00947       }
00948       break;
00949 #endif
00950       }
00951     }
00952 
00953 #if (8 != FONT_WIDTH) || (16 != FONT_WIDTH)
00954     /* Set background colour at the end of the display line. */
00955     if (textdisplay->displayDevice.colourMode ==
00956         DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME_INVERSE)
00957     {
00958       int usedBits;
00959       int startPixel = x * FONT_WIDTH;
00960       /* Check if the startPixel is not aligned at an FontBits_t boundary,
00961          meaning that we need to adjust it to the next FontBits_t boundary. */
00962       usedBits = startPixel & FONT_BITS_MASK;
00963       if (usedBits)
00964       {
00965         /* First, clear the last bits in the FontBits_t word of the startPixel. */
00966         rowPtr[startPixel>>FONT_BITS_LOG2] &= (1<<usedBits)-1;
00967         /* Adjust the startPixel to the next FontBits_t boundary. */
00968         startPixel += (sizeof(FontBits_t)*8) - usedBits;
00969       }
00970       memset (&rowPtr[startPixel>>FONT_BITS_LOG2], 0xff,
00971               (textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width - startPixel)/8);
00972     }
00973 #endif
00974 
00975     rowPtr +=
00976       textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.stride / (sizeof(FontBits_t) * 8) ;
00977   }
00978   
00979   return
00980     textdisplay->displayDevice.pPixelMatrixDraw(&textdisplay->displayDevice,
00981                                                 textdisplay->lineBuffer,
00982                                                 0,
00983                                                 textdisplay->columns*FONT_WIDTH,
00984 #ifdef EMWIN_WORKAROUND
00985                                                 textdisplay->columns*FONT_WIDTH,
00986 #endif
00987                                                 y * FONT_HEIGHT,
00988                                                 FONT_HEIGHT);
00989 }
00990 
00991 
00992 /**************************************************************************/
00999 static EMSTATUS TextdisplayUpdate(TEXTDISPLAY_Device_t*  textdisplay)
01000 {
01001   unsigned int  i;
01002   EMSTATUS      status;
01003 
01004   switch (textdisplay->updateMode)
01005   {
01006   case TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_NONE:
01007   default:
01008     break;
01009 
01010   case TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_FULL:
01011 
01012     /* Draw a full screen */
01013 
01014     switch (textdisplay->displayDevice.addressMode)
01015     {
01016     case DISPLAY_ADDRESSING_BY_ROWS_ONLY:
01017 
01018       /* Update all text lines. */
01019       for (i=0; i<textdisplay->lines; i++)
01020         /* Draw the current text line on the display. */
01021         TextdisplayLineDraw(textdisplay, i);
01022 
01023       /* Clear lowest and unused part of the screen. */
01024       if (textdisplay->lines * FONT_HEIGHT <
01025           textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.height)
01026       {
01027         switch (textdisplay->displayDevice.colourMode)
01028         {
01029         case DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME:
01030           memset (textdisplay->lineBuffer, 0x00,
01031                   textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width/8);
01032           break;
01033         case DISPLAY_COLOUR_MODE_MONOCHROME_INVERSE:
01034           memset (textdisplay->lineBuffer, 0xff,
01035                   textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width/8);
01036           break;
01037         default:
01038           return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED;
01039         }
01040 
01041         for (i = textdisplay->lines * FONT_HEIGHT;
01042              i < textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.height;
01043              i++)
01044         {
01045           status =
01046             textdisplay->displayDevice.pPixelMatrixDraw(&textdisplay->displayDevice,
01047                                                         textdisplay->lineBuffer,
01048                                                         0,
01049                                                         textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width,
01050 #ifdef EMWIN_WORKAROUND
01051                                                         textdisplay->displayDevice.geometry.width,
01052 #endif
01053                                                         i,
01054                                                         1);
01055           if (DISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK != status)
01056             return status;
01057          }
01058       }
01059       break;
01060 
01061     default:
01062       return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED;
01063     }
01064 
01065   case TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_LINE:
01066 
01067     switch (textdisplay->displayDevice.addressMode)
01068     {
01069     case DISPLAY_ADDRESSING_BY_ROWS_ONLY:
01070 
01071       /* Draw the current text line on the display. */
01072       return TextdisplayLineDraw(textdisplay, textdisplay->ypos);
01073 
01074     default:
01075       return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED;
01076     }
01077 
01078   case TEXTDISPLAY_UPDATE_MODE_CHAR:
01079     return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED;
01080   }
01081   return TEXTDISPLAY_EMSTATUS_OK;
01082 }
